First Empire Builder

The Nanda dynasty is often considered the first historical empire builder of India. It was founded by Mahapadma Nanda, who was called 'Sarvakshatrantaka' (destroyer of all Kshatriyas). He ended the Shishunaga dynasty and transformed Magadha into a vast empire that stretched from Punjab to Odisha.

ЁЯТ░
Immense Wealth and Army

The Nandas were famous for their immense wealth and large army. Greek writers referred to them as 'Aggrammes' or 'Zandremes' and described their army as consisting of 200,000 infantry, 20,000 cavalry, 2,000 chariots, and 3,000 elephants. It was due to fear of this power that Alexander's army refused to cross the Beas River.

тЪЦя╕П
Downfall

The last king, Dhanananda, was unpopular among his subjects due to his greed and heavy taxes. Chanakya (Kautilya) and Chandragupta Maurya took advantage of this discontent and overthrew the Nanda dynasty around 322 BCE, laying the foundation for the Maurya Empire.
